definition: to set/to fix/to determine/to decide/to order
to seize/to take away forcibly/to wrest control of/to compete or strive for/to force one's way through/to leave out/to lose

sentences.english: Theyseemed to end up being utilising the Sun as a compbumm to determine direction.
sentences.chinese: 它们佳似运用太阳作为指北针来定夺方向。

sentences.english: Hehas mcl poste up his mind to quit his job.
sentences.chinese: 他已定夺辞去他的职业。

sentences.english: The two sides said they keep mum over the deal because it was only tentative.
sentences.chinese: 签约两边都说不想驰扬是果为买卖本身尚未最初定夺。

sentences.english: In ancient China, marriage was often decided by parents or even the government.
sentences.chinese: 在中国的古代，婚姻大事多由父母或官府定来定夺。

sentences.english: To take or reject this offer is up to our corporate decision panel.
sentences.chinese: 接受或拒绝本提案得由本公司决策层定夺。

sentences.english: In regards to salary, I'll leave it to you to decide after you have seen the kind of work I can do.
sentences.chinese: 关于薪金，请考验本人的工作后再作定夺。

sentences.english: We are just waiting to see how this thing shakes out.
sentences.chinese: 我们正等待着看这件事的最后定夺。

definition: to make a decision/to make up one's mind
to take one's time making a decision (idiom)/to consider at length
to decide/to make decisions/to take responsibility (for deciding)/to be in charge/to give sb justice
this is no small thing (idiom)/to have a serious matter at hand
to consider/to deliberate/to fill up a cup to the brim
to reach an agreement/to agree upon
